name: Turtl
message: fix for turtl/tracker#129 ...needed to include the systems libeay32.dll/ssleay32.dll into the distribution. i thought that they wouldnt be needed because the symbols would be present in electron, but apparently loading the dll separately requires the (triggered) libs to be present. this shouldnt be an issue on linux because even base installs have ssl (although, people tend to surprise me with the essential stuff they have missing on their linux installs).

HA! fixes turtl/tracker#101

message: updates to support loading TurtlCore in worker thread. ended up not doing this for now (giving me weird errors about bindings) plus im now convinced that polling is NOT the cause of the cpu usage, so reverting to polling (but keeping some of the webworker infrastructure/reorg stuff just in case).

name: Turtl
message: whew. reorganizing things a bit more so that we do not need node in our main renderer process. basically means pulling the turtl core stuff out into a node include, and just exposing that (and ipc, obivs) via a global Node object. so far works great, but had to convert a bunch of stuff. this should protect the renderer process should anything get injected unexpectedly...although having control of the renderer is bad news bears, it will protect the host machine a bit more. also, building out the comm layer between the rendering/main threads a bit more.

name: Turtl
message: reorg, splitting out node/background libs from frontend. was getting messy, kinda vestigial from nwjs. also, dispatch can now ping/pong (not much else but its nice the server is running). up next are the popup windows. not sure what the best way to org is yet. HMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. HMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM, HMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM, HMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM  <-- that is actually the sound my brain makes when im thinking. its a great sound. believe me, people. you will love it.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Fixed #286 (Probably). Refactored the subtitles loader so it downloads the subtitle and then parses it in-memory, getting rid of CORS issues and the only reason we kept the TMP folder there. Since that was a huge piece of crap, this should get rid of all subtitle issues in Mac and some Windows installs, since you can't write to the app folder. This also makes the app more efficient, since we only download the subtitles on demand. Also rewrote the movie model so providers have to return standard movie models.

message: Turns out 200-400 connections is a lot. Now it's 100.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Upped the connection limit by a lot (it was using just 30 seeds). Now uses 100 * num cores (between 200 and 400 for most users)

name: Popcorn Time
message: A couple of changes for peerflix (fixed port and uses 127.0.0.1) Added all the node_modules so we don't hape to setup each one. Also updated peerflix dependencies to the latest bittorrent version.

name: Popcorn Time
message: The loader now gives a status (mostly for debugging).

name: Popcorn Time
message: Cleaned up the streaming code a bit.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Trigger a video exit when closing the buffering screen.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Modified the cache system. Now every torrent uses a unique cache file to prevent read conflicts and clears it when closing the video. Removed leftover debugging stuff.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Subtitles get converted to UTF-8 (now detecting the correct charset).

name: Popcorn Time
message: The scrollbars on windows now match the MacOS ones.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Full Screen on Double Click. Also a tiny bugfix on the dragging plugin

name: Popcorn Time
message: You can drag the window by the video when watching a movie

name: Popcorn Time
message: Added English/Spanish translations + language detection. Also simplified the Category list (it's taken from the Language file). This may need to be refactored.

name: Popcorn Time
message: Renamed the app. Fixed a bug with the initial loader (now there's no loader at all) Changed the preloader behavior so there's a minimum download size.

name: Popcorn Time
message: The progressbar now starts at the min-width (otherwise before the min% loads it looks like it's not doing anything)

name: Popcorn Time
message: Better subtitles (the size is dynamic and they are always at the bottom of the video).

name: Popcorn Time
message: New progress bar in buffer state

name: Popcorn Time
message: Fixed an encoding issue with subtitles (it now uses utf-8, supporting accents and things like that). It's not super clean, but it works.

name: Popcorn Time
message: All the subtitles are available during playback. In the movie details, the available subtitles section may need some UX tweaks.

name: Popcorn Time
message: The video close button behavior is now consistent with the video UI. The app now uses kiosk mode for fullscreen video (fixes a bug with Windows and overlays other windows as well). Added a couple of developer shortcuts for Windows (F11 Refreshes, F12 opens DevTools when ussing --debug)

name: Popcorn Time
message: Fixed the sidebar animation (broke it by fucking around with the comments).

name: Popcorn Time
message: Added a progress bar for the video preloader Added nice-ish native scrollbars for Windows Fixed an odd bug with the close video button Changed the loading overlay so it doesn't cover the header (otherwise you can't close the app if it freezes)
